name: Marshhead Estuary
economy_niches: harvest of ritual reagents (peat, brackish algae, marsh herbs)
tidal transshipment / lighterage for larger merchant fleets
culture_adjustments: Coastal Tongues mixed with Riveric loanwords and idioms
heightened veneration of marsh/estuary spirits and fog omens
port guild structures weakened in favor of kin-based lightering crews
oral tradition emphasizes cautionary estuary ballads and smuggling lore
constraints: seasonal navigability (restricted by tide and storm windows)
building requires piled foundations on soft ground
ritual auguries degraded by marsh miasma → higher reagent consumption
notes: key supplier of salt and ritual reagents for state ceremonies
lighterage crafts are essential logistical nodes for State_5 shipping
local customary law emphasizes tidal salvage and intertidal rights
